bibl.title: James McDevitt v. William Cochrane. Petition of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court, Third Judical District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle in King County
In the matter of the application of James McDevitt, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable Judge of the above entitled court-
The petition of James McDevitt respectfully shows:
That he said petitioner is restrained of his liberty, at the county jail of King County in the city of Seattle, by William Cochrane the Sheriff of said King County
That the pretense of said restrainment, as a commitment held by said sheriff and which is in the words and figures following
"Territory of Washington County of King} ss

To William Cochrane, and the keeper of the County Jail of King County, Whereas, at
a justices court held at my office in said county for the trial of James McDevitt for the offense hereinafter stated the said James McDevitt was convicted of hearing, on the 17th day of January 1889 in said County, committed petit larceny by stealing one hog, property of Frank Dolan valued at twenty dollars, and upon conviction its said court did adjudge and determine that the said James McDevitt should pay a fine of sixty dollars and seventy eight & 51/100 dollars costs, sixty days in County Jail, and placed committed until the same be paid, and whereas the said James McDevitt has made default in the payment of the same

Therefore you the said James Essensey Constable, are commanded in the of the United States to convey and deliver the said, James McDevitt to the said Keeper and you the said Keeper are hereby commanded to recieve this said
James McDevitt into your custody in said jail and keep him there at hard labor for the space of 105 (in all) days unless said fine and costs be sooner paid
Dated this 6th day of February 1889
James Harris Justice of the Peace
That said restraint is illegal in this -
1. The alleged judgment recited in said commitment is in excess of the judgment and jurisdiction of the court, said Justice of it's peace
2. The judgement recited in said commitment is void for

3. The pretended judgment recited in said Commitment is void in this - The said justice of the peace had amended this petitioner a trial by jury, and yet in the absence of the petitioner and without his consent, and without previewing or examining any witness or empanelling any jury or in any other manner examining
into the facts or merits of the case the said justice of the peace said the pretended judgment set in said commitment, and issued said pretended commmitment
Wherefore said petitioner prays that he may be brought before this Honorable Court, and then dealt with according to law.
He x James McDevitt Petitioner
Humes & Andrews Attys for Petitioner
Territory of Washington County of King } ss
James McDevitt being first duly sworn deposes and says; That he is the petitioner named in and making the foregoing petition - and the same is as they believes
James McDevitt
Subscribed and sworn to before me February 8th 1889
Notary Public
